content: Can you give the option to remove the SOS icon, it's really annoying and gets in the way, especially when I switch to the maps app. Edit: horrible response, Im driving, it's not dangerous, I'm not going to die. I dont need a button for 911 when I can dial it in 2 seconds. There's only so much screen on my small phone, no matter where I drag it its still annoying. I don't see why you can't just make it an "option" to disable it. Edit: By the way, it doesn't work when I press it so it's useless
replyContent: The SOS button is a safety feature that your management has added to the Driver App, giving all drivers instant access to emergency services. You can drag the SOS button to move it to a more convenient location. Please share any feedback on this feature directly with your manager, so that we can work directly with them to make any needed changes.

Additionally, the reviewer argues that the SOS button is unnecessary and useless, stating that they can dial 911 quickly without it. The repeated use of negative language and dissatisfaction indicates a negative sentiment towards the SOS icon feature.

['Based on the review provided', ' the main topics can be identified as follows:

I think I've had better results by putting it in the background instead just putting it on power saver without doing that.

content: The apple version if this app gives us the option to dismiss an order to take it off the screen. We can still pick it up at a later time. However, the android version of this app only allows us to reject orders, which is incredibly inconvenient considering that the pop-up for an order stops us from being able to complete an order. I have to ask my manager to assign me the order from the managing app, however, this is unreliable as they are busy and can't always get to me on time.

Both versions should provide the same experience.
Please contact us at product.support@bringg.com so we can have additional information and solve this issue.

content: EDIT. I have spent the last few days working with the developer team to sort out the problems. Happy to report that the latest version 1.8.0 after finishing a 10 hour shift today is working as it should. All of the problems are gone. Well done Bringg. The feedback section on the app, I found out to my surprise, was actually monitored and was the catalyst for getting the issues resolved. The change in my star rating from 1 to 4 was definitely earned by the Bringg team. Latest update has turned this app into a hot mess. Orders freeze, orders appear with no pickup details. Was always a bit buggy but never this bad. Phone restart doesn't fix the app like it used to and even a uninstall/reinstall doesn't work. It has increased the workload of me and my delco and is annoying my customers as well because they don't get delivery notifications.

content: The app for tow truck drivers will not stop sending repeated notifications until you pull up the app and tell it to stop. Most calls are received while driving and are a disturbance that will not stop unless you click through apps while driving or pull over every few minutes at high demand times. It does not stop even if the call is removed moments after receiving the notification causing the alarms to go off again and start the process all over.
replyContent:
Hi Drache, thank you for your meaningful feedback.
We definitely hear you and added a quick and safe way for you to stop the notification with minimal interaction.
Simply hit the up/down volume button and the notification sound will cease.
You will need to update your app to the latest version for that.
Have a safe drive!

content: The latest version STILL has a major glitch that needs to be immediately addressed. The logout button is 'Switch User' item on the side menu.

content:
As a veteran driver in my area, I have to say this is the most 
disappointing and frustrating method of doing my job I have ever seen. When 
the app and it' s store-based companion are working, mileage is off, it 
closes runs before they are completed, and my times are always off. I have 
to spend 15-20 minutes at the end of every shift correcting it. Good thing 
I get paid by the hour. Edit 08/09/2018 It's worse. The app falsely claims 
I have never taken a delivery on any of my shifts (avg is 5-20 per shift). 
Also, it keeps NO record of order history whatsoever. On a brand new 
Motorola e5 play Android phone. Verizon prepaid. This app needs to be 
scrapped. I have zero faith it can be fixed.
sentiment: The sentiment of this review is negative.
topics:
['Based on the review', ' the main topics can be identified as:

1. App functionality: The review mentions issues with the app and its store-based companion', ' such as incorrect mileage tracking', ' premature closure of runs', " and inaccurate timing.

2. Time-consuming corrections: The review mentions spending extra time at the end of each shift to correct the app's errors.

3. Payment: The review mentions being paid by the hour", " which implies that the app's issues may not directly impact the driver's earnings.

4. Record keeping: The review highlights the app's failure to keep records of order history", ' which could be an important feature for the driver.

5. Device compatibility: The review mentions using a Motorola e5 play Android phone with Verizon prepaid', " suggesting that the app's issues may be specific to certain devices or network providers.

6. Overall dissatisfaction: The review expresses disappointment and frustration with the app", ' suggesting that the user has lost faith in its ability to be fixed and may want it to be replaced entirely.']

content: Way too intrusive. There is no need to have all the permissions it does have, like my camera because my camera isn't used for delivering. The app itself is somewhat alright but I haven't had the chance to check to see if the mileage is working. But the navigation on the computer in the store is the crappiest I've ever seen. There is no sense of order with drivers. I've delivered before, the general rule of driving is first in, first out. But because of the lack in having drivers names go in order of who came back when, we are currently sharing orders. As in if I'm doing a good job driving, getting to my deliveries and back in the right amount of time, I'm not going to be rewarded with more deliveries, I'm going to have to stay and do second tasks because we should have a fairly equal amount of deliveries. Not just regular deliveries, basically how many times you've left the store. So my coworker can go on 3 deliveries that have 3 orders each, but if I take 5 singles I'm considered "ahead" and it should not work that way. Also clocking in and out should have a password. It's way too unsafe without it. As well as allowing drivers to see how many deliveries each other has taken (or how many times we've left the store) causes unhealthy competition between coworkers. Please fix. Please do research on how to make a good working environment and how to keep your drivers happy amongst each other as well as keeping our information safe.
replyContent:
Hi Elora,
Thank you for your feedback.
I recommend reaching out to your dispatcher/admin, who can forward your requests to your Customer Success Manager or to our Support Team.

Thanks again,
Bringg Team
sentiment: The sentiment of this review is mostly negative. The reviewer expresses frustration with the app's intrusive permissions, the poor navigation experience in-store, and the lack of order with drivers. They also mention issues with the reward system, clocking in and out, and the unhealthy competition between coworkers. Overall, the tone of the review suggests dissatisfaction and a desire for improvements to be made.
topics:

content: So many things wrong with this app. Notifications often don't come through for new jobs, then several come through at the same time so you can't see the info you originally needed until you clear all the jobs. The link to google maps is awful due to the address fields being all messed up. Most of the time i have to delete the address and enter manually as google doesn't recognise the data. Sometimes no address at all comes through, other times no food order details or customer information. I have to restart the app constantly to refresh it. Also the app is unresponsive to presses half the time. I press to say I've started a job only to arrive at the customers to find it didn't actually press. Oh and that floating notification ball thing is pointless and useless and doesn't respond to being pressed 90% of the time and freezes the screen behind it when being used, which defeats the object of having it floating. Unfortunately, I have to use this app every day.

content: I really can't stand this app and hate that I have to use it for work. It constantly drains my battery and when I go to charge it, it charges slow and overheats my battery. I'll start my shift at 8:30 with a 100% battery life go on 3 or 4 deliveries and then my battery life is almost at 75% within 2 hours. I put the app in background once I'm finished with my deliveries but that doesn't help with charging at all. If the developers could do something bout this I would have no problems with the app. It is useful and helps with deliveries, but draining and overheating my battery is a problem.
sentiment: The sentiment of this review is negative. The reviewer expresses dislike and frustration towards the app, particularly due to its negative impact on their device's battery life and charging speed. However, they also acknowledge that the app is useful for their work and would have no issues if the battery drain and overheating problems were resolved.
topics:
['Based on the review', ' the main topics can be identified as follows:

1. App performance: The reviewer expresses frustration with the app', " stating that they can't stand it and hate having to use it for work. They mention that the app constantly drains their battery and causes it to overheat.

2. Battery drainage: The reviewer complains about how quickly the app drains their battery. They provide an example of starting their shift with a full battery and seeing it drop to 75% within two hours", ' despite only completing a few deliveries.

3. Charging issues: The reviewer mentions that when they try to charge their phone', " the app slows down the charging process and causes the battery to overheat. They express disappointment that putting the app in the background doesn't help with charging.

4. Request for improvement: The reviewer suggests that if the developers could address the battery drainage and overheating issues", ' they would have no problems with the app. They acknowledge that the app is useful for deliveries but emphasize the need for better battery performance.']
